text: Fernando Risi was an Italian cinematographer.Waldman p.158 ==Selected filmography== * The Confessions of a Woman (1928) * Queen of the Night (1931) * Television (1931) * The Doctor's Secret (1931) * No Man's Land (1939) * Antonio Meucci (1940) * Saint John, the Beheaded (1940) * The Brambilla Family Go on Holiday (1941) * The Beggar's Daughter (1950) * Beauties on Bicycles (1951) * If You Won a Hundred Million (1953) == References == == Bibliography == * Waldman, Harry. Missing Reels: Lost Films of American and European Cinema. McFarland, 2000. == External links == * Category:1890 births Category:Year of death unknown Category:Italian cinematographers Category:People from Rome
title: Fernando Risi
